text: RT @J_Wade_Miller Everyone, please put a prayer out for the victims at the @nytimes who had to endure the civil rights violation of having to read words they disagree with.  Having to go through that is basically the same thing as storming the beach at Normandy on D-Day.  #NYTimes http://pbs.twimg.com/tweet_video_thumb/EZo9UNOXgAEBzKy.jpg https://video.twimg.com/tweet_video/EZo9UNOXgAEBzKy.mp4

RT @RepPressley Qualified immunity shields police from accountability, impedes true justice, and undermines the constitutional rights of every person in this country. 

It’s past time we end #QualifiedImmunity, and I’m introducing legislation with @justinamash to do exactly that. https://twitter.com/justinamash/status/1268353415295500289 QT @justinamash Excited to announce that @RepPressley will co-lead the bill to end qualified immunity. We’ll work relentlessly to build support within Congress for this critical legislation. Police must be held accountable when they violate people’s rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZoYs6pXgAEeKK8.jpg
RT @amyyqin Surreal and horrifying to wake up on the morning of June 4 - the 31st anniversary of the Tiananmen Square crackdown - to this headline. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZoNRinUEAADGb7.jpg

Can you explain why you chose to publish misinformation in your pages in service of an “opinion” for state violence?

Can you explain your choice to publish it on the anniversary of Tiananmen Square?

Do you believe your Black colleagues saying your choices have put them at risk? https://twitter.com/jbennet/status/1268328283646521344 QT @JBennet We understand that many readers find Senator Cotton's argument painful, even dangerous. We believe that is one reason it requires public scrutiny and debate.

The Senate was able to pass the changes to #PPP last night & will soon be signed in to law by @potus. 

#smallbusiness will now have 24 weeks to spend #PPPloans

And 60% must be for payroll

Good bi-partisan/bi-cameral work to get this done.

Have we not all one father?

Has not one God created us?

Why, then, do we break faith with each other?

Malachi 2:10
This time it’s different.

Racism against Black folks, Latinos, Asians, and our Native brothers and sisters is bad for everyone. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268374188668194817/img/3BbnOSqg9DxR98J6.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268374188668194817/vid/320x320/ttG4PC9fHpRy8Jzs.mp4?tag=13

11 months ago I proposed a federal commission to investigate potential civil rights violations & disparities affecting black males & issue an annual report & recommendations to Congress & POTUS

I am working to pass it in Senate ASAP via expedited process https://www.rubio.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/7/rubio-harris-booker-introduce-legislation-to-establish-commission-devoted-to-uplifting-black-communities
This morning, the Senate Judiciary Committee isn’t voting on legislation to confront the life or death crises before us. Instead, it’s nursing Trump’s wounded ego with a partisan subpoena. Shameful.

Last night, I thanked members of the @UTNationalGuard deployed to protect the nation’s capital. When the nation needs help, Utahns answer the call. I am grateful to these dedicated soldiers for helping preserve the peace and protect life and property during this difficult time. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZrEvkGXgAAA0Qq.jpg

Mr.Floyd’s murder is the catalyst for the protests but not the only thing they are about. For too long unacceptable disparities have gone unaddressed. 

We need action. But action begins by listening so we understand the problem & then coming up with answers that work. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268537097952124929/pu/img/cH_EJMaaCt-qctea.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268537097952124929/pu/vid/320x356/wCAuHI77jl9bXYSj.mp4?tag=10

The #Tiananmen Mothers have carried that torch for 31 years, ensuring the world has never forgotten the sacrifice of so many in the face of tyranny. We honor you. #TiananmenVigil #IWOC http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZmyT8kXsAA84sB.jpg

RT @civilrightsorg "The way this young man died, watching the video, it made me so sad. It was so painful. It made me cry. I kept saying to myself, how many more? How many more young Black men will be murdered? The madness must stop."

–@repjohnlewis
#BlackLivesMatter http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1268517908646330374/img/i-Fjari0bnTFSoWP.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1268517908646330374/vid/480x270/RmTbRT8_EPBhu3jl.mp4?tag=13

Two years after protestors were met with violence & death, I joined my colleagues in unfurling a banner in Tiananmen Square which read: “To those who died for democracy.”

To this day, we are firmly committed to standing up against China’s abuses of human rights. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EZrSAmjXkAIgHAk.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268554327423168519/pu/vid/320x320/puXeIFKYztoezvQk.mp4?tag=10

For 31 years, the courageous students, workers and citizens who defied an oppressive Chinese regime in #Tiananmen Square have lived in the memory of all freedom-loving people. May their example move us to ensure that America truly lives up to its ideals. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/6320-1
The officers who murdered Breonna Taylor nearly three months ago still have not been charged. We can’t forget about Black women in our quest for justice.
Every police department violating people's civil rights must be stripped of federal funding.

Congratulations! https://twitter.com/hcsotexas/status/1268317310420430852 QT @HCSOTexas We organized a drive-by parade for Christian Polk in honor of his recent graduation from @YESPrepIKE. Christian is the son of our brother, Sgt. Dwayne Polk, who was killed by a drunk driver in 2013.

Congratulations Christian! We wish you all the best in your future endeavors! http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1268314329679626241/pu/img/GTUNz_Gj0P5jo94X.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1268314329679626241/pu/vid/480x270/T6d4yLFfnSRIpASi.mp4?tag=10

I wrote this op-ed for the Stanford student newspaper back in 1992 shortly after the Rodney King verdict. It pains me that the words I wrote about racial injustice back then still ring true today.

Many Black Americans whose names we didn't learn have died in custody. Andrew Kearse had a heart attack while begging officers for help. The video is sickening. Today, George Floyd's family prepares for the painful task of laying to rest their loved one.
